revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2017}} {{Infobox person |name = Melissa Rauch |image = Melissa Rauch - PaleyFest 2013.jpg |caption = Rauch at [[PaleyFest]] 2013 for ''[[The Big Bang Theory]]'' |birth_name = Melissa Ivy Rauch |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1980|6|23}} |birth_place = [[Marlboro Township, New Jersey]], U.S. |occupation = Actress, comedian |television = ''[[The Big Bang Theory]]'' |death_date = |death_place = |other_names = |website = |spouse = Winston Rauch (né Beigel){{cite news| url=http://www.morningjournal.com/general-news/20140606/melissa-rauch-movie-the-bronze-to-shoot-june-29-in-amherst| title=Melissa Rauch movie 'The Bronze' to shoot June 29 in Amherst| work=[[Morning Journal]]| location=[[Lisbon, Ohio]]| date=June 6, 2014| accessdate=February 4, 2015| last=Harper| first=Carol| archivedate= May 15, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160515045454/http://www.morningjournal.com/general-news/20140606/melissa-rauch-movie-the-bronze-to-shoot-june-29-in-amherst| deadurl=no}}{{cite news| url=http://limaohio.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?avis=LI&date=20140606&category=news&lopenr=306069973&Ref=AR| title=‘Bronze’ to film downtown| work=Oberlin News| date= June 29, 2014| last=Hawk| first=Jason| accessdate=February 4, 2015| archivedate=July 26, 2016 | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140726202820/http://limaohio.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?avis=LI&date=20140606&category=news&lopenr=306069973&Ref=AR }} | children = 1 |years_active = 2006–present }} '''Melissa Ivy Rauch''' (born June 23, 1980) is an American actress and comedian. She is known for playing [[List of The Big Bang Theory characters#Bernadette|Bernadette Rostenkowski-Wolowitz]] on the [[CBS]] sitcom ''[[The Big Bang Theory]]''. ==Early life== Rauch was born to a [[American Jews|Jewish]] family in [[Marlboro Township, New Jersey]].{{cite news |url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/life/television/news/story/2011-11-16/cbs-big-bang-theory/51248274/1 |title=Mayim Bialik and Melissa Rauch Five Questions |work=[[USA Today]] |date=November 17, 2011| first=Jayme| last=Deerwester |accessdate=February 4, 2015| archivedate= April 15, 2015| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20150415054106/http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/life/television/news/story/2011-11-16/cbs-big-bang-theory/51248274/1| deadurl=no}}{{Cite web|last=Bloom|first=Nate|authorlink=Nate Bloom|title=Jewish Stars 1/27 |publisher=[[Cleveland Jewish News]]|date=January 26, 2012 |url=https://www.clevelandjewishnews.com/archives/jewish-stars/article_700182ca-484d-11e1-98a9-001871e3ce6c.html|accessdate=}} Her parents are Susan and David Rauch.{{cite web| url=http://broadwayworld.com/people/galleryphoto.php?photoid=8847&personid=9128| title=Winston Beigel| publisher=Broadwayworld.com| date=August 14, 2005| accessdate=February 4, 2015| archivedate= March 4, 2016| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20160304211719/http://www.broadwayworld.com/people/galleryphoto.php?photoid=8847&personid=9128| deadurl=no|quote=[Photo caption] Melissa Rauch with parents Susan & David Rauch, brother Ben Rauch, and boyfriend Winston Beigel at ''The Miss Education of Jenna Bush''}}{{cite journal| url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/melissa-rauch/bio/198404| title=Melissa Rauch: Biography| publisher=[[TV Guide|TVGuide.com]]| accessdate=February 4, 2015| archivedate= July 19, 2016| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20160729062135/http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/melissa-rauch/bio/198404}} She has a brother, Ben. She developed an interest in acting while attending [[Marlboro High School]].{{cite journal| last=Considine| first=Bob| url=http://www.nj.com/inside-jersey/index.ssf/2011/05/take_five_with_melissa_rauch.html| title=Take Five With Melissa Rauch| work=[[The Star-Ledger]]| location=Newark| date=May 17, 2011| accessdate=February 4, 2015| quote="I also had a terrific theater teacher at Marlboro High School who taught me a great deal and was very encouraging. There wasn't a ton to do in Marlboro, so for me, it was either hang outside the Wawa or put on a show."}} Rauch graduated from [[Marymount Manhattan College]] in New York City in 2002.{{cite web|url=http://www.biography.com/people/melissa-rauch-090315|title=Melissa Rauch Biography: Television Actress (1980–) | last=Mead|first=Wendy|publisher=[[Biography.com]] ([[FYI (TV network)|FYI]] / [[A&E Networks]] | accessdate=January 29, 2016| archivedate= October 8, 2016| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20161008111645/http://www.biography.com/people/melissa-rauch-090315| deadurl=no}} ==Career== Some of Rauch's early work was as a regular contributor to [[VH1]]'s ''[[Best Week Ever]]'' television show.{{cite web| date=May 29, 2008| url=http://www.bestweekever.tv/tag/melissa-rauch | title=Profiles in Panelism: Melissa Rauch| work=[[Best Week Ever]]}} In 2009, Rauch began playing the recurring role of Bernadette Rostenkowski, a co-worker of [[Penny (The Big Bang Theory)|Penny]] who began to date [[Howard Wolowitz]], in the third season of TV's ''[[The Big Bang Theory]]''.{{cite journal| url=http://www.backstage.com/interview/the-big-bang-theory-cast-on-being-part-of-an-ensemble/| title='The Big Bang Theory' Cast On Being Part of an Ensemble| first=Jenelle| last=Riley| work=[[Backstage (magazine)|Backstage]]| date=November 29, 2012| accessdate=February 4, 2015}} The following season her character became Howard's fiancée and Rauch was promoted to a series regular. The characters married in the season five finale. In December 2011, Rauch and fellow cast members of ''The Big Bang Theory'' received the first of four nominations for the [[Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Comedy Series]].{{cite press release| title=Nominations Announced for the 18th Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards® |url=http://www.sagawards.org/media-pr/11213| date=December 14, 2011| publisher=Screen Actors Guild| accessdate=February 4, 2015}}{{cite press release| title=Nominations Announced for the 19th Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards® |url=http://www.sagawards.org/media-pr/press-releases/nominations-announced-19th-annual-screen-actors-guild-awards%C2%AE| date=December 12, 2012| publisher=Screen Actors Guild| accessdate=February 4, 2015}}{{cite press release| title=Nominations Announced for the 20th Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards® |url=http://www.sagawards.org/media-pr/press-releases/nominations-announced-20th-annual-screen-actors-guild-awards%C2%AE| date=December 13, 2013| publisher=Screen Actors Guild| accessdate=February 4, 2015}}{{cite news| title=SAG Awards 2015: Complete List of Nominations! |url=http://www.eonline.com/news/604452/sag-awards-2015-complete-list-of-nominations| date=December 10, 2014| work=[[E! News]]| last=Johnson| first=Zach| accessdate=February 4, 2015}} Other acting credits include ''[[True Blood]]'' (on which she had a recurring role in 2010 as [[List of True Blood characters#Summer|Summer]], a girl who likes [[List of True Blood characters#Hoyt|Hoyt]]), ''[[The Office (U.S. TV series)|The Office]]'', the [[Kath & Kim (U.S. TV series)|American remake]] of the Australian TV series ''[[Kath & Kim]]'', ''Wright v Wrong'', and the film ''[[I Love You, Man]]''. Rauch is also part of the cast of the comedic stage show ''The Realest Real Housewives'' with [[Casey Wilson]], [[June Diane Raphael]], [[Jessica St. Clair]] and [[Danielle Schneider]]. The show began running at the [[Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre]] in 2011.{{cite journal| url=http://www.laweekly.com/arts/the-realest-real-housewives-at-ucb-a-celebration-of-the-best-show-ever-paul-scheer-2374472| title=The Realest Real Housewives at UCB: A Celebration of the Best Show Ever + Paul Scheer| last=Trachta| first=Ali| date=January 29, 2011| work=[[LA Weekly]]| accessdate=February 4, 2015}} Rauch co-wrote and co-produced the film ''[[The Bronze (film)|The Bronze]]'', in which she starred as Hope Annabelle Greggory, a [[bronze medal]]-winning [[Gymnastics|gymnast]] clinging to her glory days of 12 years earlier. It opened the 2015 [[Sundance Film Festival]].{{Cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/film/festivals/5-reasons-the-bronze-could-be-a-breakout-comedy-in-2015-1201412800/|title=5 Reasons ''The Bronze'' Could be a Breakout Comedy in 2015|last=Setoodeh|first=Ramin|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]| date= January 23, 2015|access-date=April 24, 2016| archivedate= November 6, 2016| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20161106155528/http://variety.com/2015/film/festivals/5-reasons-the-bronze-could-be-a-breakout-comedy-in-2015-1201412800/| deadurl=no}} ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' said, "Rauch, who co-wrote the screenplay with her husband Winston, has never carried a film before. But she delivers the best breakthrough comedic performance by an actress since [[Melissa McCarthy]] in ''[[Bridesmaids (2011 film)|Bridesmaids]]''." Sony Pictures Classics acquired the film in September 2015.{{Cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/09/the-bronze-sony-pictures-classics-release-date-relativity-media-1201522219/|title=Ex-Relativity Pic ''The Bronze'' Lands at Sony Pictures Classics|last=Pedersen|first=Erik|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]| date= September 11, 2015|access-date=April 24, 2016| archivedate=August 22, 2016 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20160822214338/http://deadline.com/2015/09/the-bronze-sony-pictures-classics-release-date-relativity-media-1201522219/| deadurl=no}} In 2017, Rauch voiced [[Harley Quinn]] in the animated film ''[[Batman and Harley Quinn]]'' and she voiced Light Thief in Light Riders from [[Blaze and the Monster Machines]]. ==Personal life== Rauch is married to writer Winston Rauch (né Beigel), who collaborated with her on ''The Miss Education of Jenna Bush'' and other projects.{{cite journal| first=Stephen M.| last=Silverman| work=[[People (magazine)|People]]| url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,1096008,00.html| title=Jenna Bush Takes Center Stage in New York| date=August 19, 2005| accessdate=February 4, 2015}} Rauch announced that she was pregnant on July 11, 2017, and disclosed that she had a miscarriage previously.{{cite web|url=https://www.glamour.com/story/actress-melissa-rauch-announces-pregnancy-and-reflects-on-miscarriage|title='Big Bang Theory' Star Melissa Rauch Announces Her Pregnancy and Reflects on Previous Miscarriage|first=Melissa|last=Rauch|date=|website=glamour.com|accessdate=September 27, 2017}} On December 4, 2017 Rauch announced on Instagram that she had given birth to a girl, Sadie.{{cite journal|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/melissa-rauch-welcomes-a-beautiful-baby-girl-named-sadie_us_5a267e75e4b0f9f0203f0c24|title=Actress Melissa Rauch Welcomes A ‘Beautiful Baby Girl’ Named Sadie|work=The Huffington Post}} Rauch modeled the voice of [[List of The Big Bang Theory characters#Bernadette|Bernadette]] after her parents: the "sweet, high-pitched purr" is modeled after her mother, while the "eerie, haranguing imitation" of [[Mrs. Wolowitz]] is modeled after her father.{{cite web|url=https://nypost.com/2013/03/24/screaming-success/|title=Screaming success|last=Getlen|first=Larry|date=March 24, 2013|work=[[New York Post]]|accessdate=September 27, 2015}} Both are "very different" from Rauch's real voice.{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/11/16/melissa-rauch-maxim_n_4288568.html|title=Melissa Rauch of ''Big Bang Theory'' Does S&M-Inspired Photo Shoot for Maxim|date=November 16, 2013|work=[[The Huffington Post]]|accessdate=September 27, 2015}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Film ! Year ! Title ! Role ! class="unsortable" | Notes |- | 2006 | ''[[Delirious (2006 film)|Delirious]]'' | Megan | |- | 2009 | ''[[I Love You, Man]]'' | Woman Jogger Yelling at Sidney | |- | 2009 | ''The Condom Killer'' | Audra | Short |- | 2013 | ''In Lieu of Flowers'' | Carrie | |- | 2014 | ''[[Are You Here]]'' | Marie | |- | 2015 | ''[[The Bronze (film)|The Bronze]]'' | Hope Annabelle Greggory | Also writer |- | 2016 | ''[[Ice Age: Collision Course]]'' | Francine (voice) | |- | 2016 | ''[[Flock of Dudes]]'' | Jamie | |- | 2017 | ''[[Batman and Harley Quinn]]'' | [[Harley Quinn]] (voice) | Direct-to-video |} {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Television ! Season 4–present (series regular) |- | 2010 | ''[[The Office (U.S. TV series)|The Office]]'' | Cathy Duke | 1 episode |- | 2010 | ''[[True Blood]]'' | Summer | Season 3 (recurring; 6 episodes) |- | 2010 | ''Wright vs. Wrong'' | Daisy Cake | TV movie |- | 2014 | ''[[Jake and the Never Land Pirates]]'' | First-Mate Mollie (voice) | 1 episode
"Smee-erella" |- | 2014 | ''[[Teenage Fairytale Dropouts]]''{{cite web| url=https://www.facebook.com/animaestudios/photos/a.788748194472896.1073741825.209025339111854/900700549944326/?type=1| title=Ánima Estudios – Mobile Uploads|work=facebook.com|accessdate=December 10, 2014}} | Miss Macabre | 1 episode
"Something Wicked This Way Substitutes" |- | 2014 | ''The Hot Housewives of Orlando'' | Calliope | 1 episode |- | 2015 | ''[[Sofia the First]]'' | Fairy Tizzy (voice) | 1 episode{{cite press release| title=Second Season of Disney Junior's Hit Series "Sofia the First" Debuts Friday, March 7 on Disney Channel |url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2014/02/07/second-season-of-disney-juniors-hit-series-sofia-the-first-debuts-friday-march-7-on-disney-channel-697403/20140207disney01/| accessdate=February 4, 2015| work=[[The Futon Critic]]| publisher=[[Disney Channel]]| date=February 7, 2014}} |- | 2015 | ''[[Scooby-Doo! and the Beach Beastie]]'' | Kiki (voice) | TV Movie |- | 2017 | ''[[Star vs. the Forces of Evil]]'' | Baby (voice) | 1 episode |- | 2017 | ''[[Ant-Man (2017 TV series)|''Marvel's Ant-Man'']]'' | [[Hope Pym|The Wasp]] (voice) | 2 episodes |- | 2017 |''[[Blaze and the Monster Machines]]'' | Light Thief (voice) | 1 episode |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Melissa Rauch}} * {{Twitter}} * {{IMDb name|1851981|Melissa Rauch}} *{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/10/11/big-bang-theory-melissa-rauch_n_1005581.html|title='The Big Bang Theory' Star Melissa Rauch On Nerds, New Jersey And 'Real Housewives'|last=Gostin|first=Nicki|date=December 11, 2011|work=[[The Huffington Post]]|accessdate=January 29, 2016}} *{{cite web|url=http://www.maxim.com/women-az/melissa-rauch-profile|title=Melissa Rauch – Gallery|work=[[Maxim (magazine)|Maxim]]|accessdate=January 29, 2016}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rauch, Melissa}} [[Category:1980 births]] [[Category:Actresses from New Jersey]] [[Category:Jewish American actresses]] [[Category:American television actresses]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Marymount Manhattan College alumni]] [[Category:People from Marlboro Township, New Jersey]] [[Category:American women comedians]] [[Category:21st-century American actresses]] [[Category:American film actresses]] [[Category:American voice actresses]]
